_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Spray Products Corporation's personnel in Medina, Ohio take great pride in maintaining a safe operation for the employees, the community, and the environment.  The primary focus is to prevent accidental releases before they occur while providing systems that minimize the size of any release that does occur and contain it in as small as area as possible.





ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES:  It is Spray Products, Corporation's policy to operate its plants in a manner that protect its employees, the public, and the environment.  It is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local laws.  The Spray Products, Corporation, Medina, Ohio facility has a detailed, practiced Emergency Response Plan that is utilized to respond to any accidental releases.





FACILITY DESCRIPTION:  The Spray Products, Corporation, Medina, Ohio facility manufactures Specialty Chemicals, Industrial and Automotive commodities, and paint, coatings and adhesives.  The majority of the products manufactured at the plant are filled in Aerosol cans.  The facility operates several storage tanks that contain a flammable mixture of propane, n-butane, and/or isobutane that is used as propellants for the aerosol cans.  In addition, the facility operates an on-site warehouse for storage of Manufactured bulk and Aerosol commodities.  



GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS:  The Medina, Ohio Facility has implemented the OSHA Process Safety Management Standard, which is a systematic method of preventing accidental releases and complies with EPA's accident prevention rule.  As such, the facility has completed a detailed analysis on the process to ensure the safe use and operation of the applicable equipment.   Numerous safeguards are in place and include Operational Procedures, manual and automated control systems, safety interlocks, and other accepted good engineering and industry practices.  The facility uses both

procedural as well as technological systems to ensure safe handling of the flammable propellant mixture.





FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY:  The Spray Products, Corporation, Medina, Ohio plant has never had an accident involving flammable propellants that resulted in injuries, property damage or environmental releases.





EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM:  In the event of an emergency involving flammable propellants, plant personnel will notify the Medina Fire Department and rely on their expertise to handle the situation.  We have provided the fire department with our Emergency Response Plan and members of the fire department have inspected the plant.  In addition, Spray Products has a contract with a qualified emergency response firm to aid in the cleanup of a release.





PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY:  Several developments and findings have resulted from the implementation of the various elements of our accidental release prevention program.  Employee suggestions, vendor equipment updates, process re-engineering, and hazard analysis are some of the steps we take to improve safety at our facility.  These steps are continuous and on-going.
